alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:21PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of the southern City of Norfolk, the central City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth, and the northwestern City of Virginia Beach through 300 PM EDT... At 221 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cradock, or near Deep Creek, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Norfolk International, Ghent, Norview, Cradock, South Norfolk, Rudee Heights, Portlock and Princess Anne Plaza. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
